meanings.sent1: The tree had protrusive roots that tripped unwary hikers.
meanings.sent2: The lizard's protrusive tongue quickly caught a passing insect.
meanings.sent3: The protrusive branches of the bush seemed to wave hello in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her protrusive curiosity led her to explore every corner of the old house.
meanings.sent5: The protrusive mountain dominated the landscape, drawing all eyes towards it.

meanings.definition: Tending to push outward or extend beyond a surface
meanings.sent1: The toddler's protrusive behavior often got him into trouble.
meanings.sent2: The balloon's protrusive shape made it difficult to fit through the door.
meanings.sent3: The protrusive umbrella kept poking unsuspecting passersby.
meanings.sent4: His protrusive personality always made him the center of attention.
meanings.sent5: The protrusive force of the explosion shattered the windows in an instant.
